header: Isaiah Offers Hope to King Ahaz

verse: Ahaz, the son of Jotham and the grandson of Uzziah, was king of Judah when King Rezin of Syria and King Pekah son of Remaliah of Israel went to attack Jerusalem. But they were not able to do what they had planned.
When news reached the royal palace that Syria had joined forces with Israel, King Ahaz and everyone in Judah were so terrified that they shook like trees in a windstorm.
Then the Lord said to me:
Once again the Lord God spoke to King Ahaz. This time he said,
“Ask me for proof that my promise will come true. Ask for something to happen deep in the world of the dead or high in the heavens above.”
“No, Lord,” Ahaz answered. “I won’t test you!”
